page.title: 01Chudleigh description
page.content: The ancient wool town of Chudleigh received its charter in 1309 and today has a population of approximately 2,500. It lies astride the old main road between Exeter and Plymouth and was once a prominent coaching stop on this route. Ugbrooke House and park, owned by Lord and Lady Clifford, is located ne of Chudleigh and is open to the public between April and October. The area is bisected n and s by the River Teign and also by the new A38 trunk road. In the nw corner of the area is Trusham quarry and precast concrete works, a major source of employment in the area. The area has numerous arable and dairy farms and quite a bit of woodland. Commuting is easy to both Exeter and Newton Abbot. New houses are being built to accommodate the floating population for Newton Abbot and Exeter.
